other_tests.findings: The patient developed supraventricular tachycardia shortly after his wife began yelling, which then degenerated to atrial fibrillation with a rapid ventricular response.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Following electrophysiology testing and ablation, neither atrial flutter nor supraventricular tachycardia could be reinduced and the patient has remained free of atrial tachyarrhythmias for almost 4 years.

other_tests.findings: Atrial flutter was easily induced and then degenerated to atrial fibrillation, requiring electrical cardioversion.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Following the procedure, no atrial flutter or supraventricular tachycardia could be reinduced.

other_tests.findings: The patient was found to have multivessel coronary artery disease.
Patient has normal left ventricular function.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Patient has not had any recurrent cardiac events.
